node.title: Man escapes quarantine and heads to Darwin's party strip before being located by police
node.alt: Aerials drone pics of Howard Springs Quarantine Facility.
node.description: A man who allegedly snuck out of the Howard Springs quarantine facility is found by police almost six hours later at a licensed venue in the Darwin CBD.
node.content: ["Northern Territory police are investigating after a 27-year-old man allegedly escaped from the Howard Springs quarantine facility and ended up at a licensed venue\u00a0on Darwin's main party strip overnight.", "According to police, a passing motorist spotted the man scaling the fence of the facility and being picked up by a white ute on Howard Springs Road just before 6pm yesterday.", "Police searched for the man throughout the night before finding him just before midnight at a licensed premises on Mitchell Street, in Darwin's\u00a0CBD.\u00a0", "The man was returned\u00a0to Howard Springs where he\u00a0underwent\u00a0an urgent\u00a0PCR\u00a0test.", "He\u00a0has since tested negative for COVID-19.", "Police are continuing to investigate, including anyone who was involved in picking up the man outside the facility.", "They are urging anyone\u00a0who witnessed the incident or has any information that could help to contact them\u00a0on 131 444, and quote reference number 9858994.", "The man's escape comes as the NT continues to face its\u00a0biggest COVID outbreak\u00a0yet, with 52 cases detected in the town of\u00a0Katherine and a number of remote communities.\u00a0", "The incident is not the first time a person has escaped from quarantine in Howard Springs.", "In January, a 33-year-old Victorian woman scaled the fence\u00a0and walked off in broad daylight, but police located her within about 15 minutes.", "She was later\u00a0fined more than $5,000."]
